questions.explanation:
Denver.

	Real name Henry John Deutchendorf, John Denver was one of the most acomplished recording artists of the 1970s. He died on October 12, 1997, when the experimental aircraft he was piloting crashed.

questions.text: Author of 'Call of the Wild', Jack_______?
questions.explanation:
London.

	Jack London died aged 40 of kidney disease. He left behind over 50 books of novels, stories and essays.

Lancaster.

	Burt Lancaster is best remembered for his portrayal of Robert Stroud, the famed 'Birdman of Alcatraz'.

Berlin.

	Irving Berlin lived to be over 100 and wrote over 1000 songs.

Manchester.

	Melissa Manchester was once Bette Midler's back up singer. Her hits include 'Midnight Blue' and 'You Should Hear How She Talks About You'.

Lincoln.

	'Honest Abe', was assassinated at Fords Theater in Washington DC in 1865.

questions.text: Acting father and son, Douglas_____________Sr. and Jr.?
questions.explanation:
Fairbanks.

	Two of Hollywood's most memorable characters.

Boston.

	David Boston was born in Texas and is a wide receiver for the Arizona Cardinals.

Phoenix.

	River Phoenix was born River Jude Bottom on August 23, 1970, near Metolius, Oregon. He died on October 31, 1993.

Bolton.

	Michael Bolton has won Grammys for 'Best Male Vocalist', and has sold over 45 million records worldwide.
